title.label: Why am I seeing ads after having purchased the game?

content.label:
I purchased this game long ago and now I‚Äôm seeing ads? Despicable. Apparently there are supposed to be ads between levels if you haven‚Äôt paid. I don‚Äôt see those, but I still have to click an ‚Äúx‚Äù to close an ad for a SEGA game each and every time I start the game. This is incredibly misleading and a really dishonest practice.

In addition to that, I find d-pad too far to the left edge of the screen. A simple option to move it is virtually expected in a game like this. There seem to be virtually no control options, which is really lazy considering there are literally two things to touch on the screen.

title.label: Too many Ads and missing Sonic Boom

content.label: Title says it all. The disappointment started with the missing American opening, Sonic Boom and ended with WAY too many ads to make this enjoyable.

History seems to repeat itself, it‚Äôs been proven many times, and just like in the 90‚Äôs, they tried selling this lost piece of hot garbage as a game with aggressive ads. The only difference is... THEY MADE IT WORSE!!! How do you screw something up that has so much potential, here‚Äôs some issues, the time stones disappear from your collection, making the good ending IMPOSSIBLE, how do you screw up an important mechanic like this , and good luck getting even close to obtaining these disappearing gems because the UFO‚Äôs are rigged to move away from you in directions you can‚Äôt reach, and usually, you just end up diving into water, draining your time, all that stress just to have those gems gone! The only thing you did right was the freaking options, and even those are bugged, if you are gonna release a classic game mobile, especially a bad game, then have the decency to fix that game, if you can completely change up sonic 1/2 levels, and mechanics, then this game shouldn‚Äôt be too hard either.

It‚Äôs a good game don‚Äôt get me wrong,but WHY did you HAVE to bring back the horrific message and have the music,the USA boss(in case you didn‚Äôt know)play in the background?overall,a pretty solid game,just the USA music is kinda creepy.

Ok SEGA, We need to talk.
Your Sonic CD mobile port is a great port to The IOS and android systems.
The addition of tails, The Responsive controls made the game feel good, but I‚Äôm not here to talk about that.
I‚Äôm here to talk about the ads in the game, and oh boy, it‚Äôs a doozy.
First of all, there are TOO many ads, when I click start,AD, Complete a level, AD, Die? AD!
Many actions take you to an ad, and it gets worse than just that.
Number 2: The content of some ads can be malicious at some times, some times when I just try to do go do some thing on the title screen, it takes me to my browser to one of those Fake win prize scams, and that is WRONG to put in a game that could be played by CHILDREN, who might fall for the scam, Enter details, and the parents bank account? GONE.
Now, this is unlikely to happen, but hey, it could.
Finally: Why are there this many ads? The other sonic 1 and 2 ports had much less ads, but this game just bombards you with adverts and people HATE that many ads, if you want to get a higher rating on the App Store, I suggest you get rid of some ads, like for when you die or complete a level.
That is the end of the review, sorry sega.
Seeing a black screen uwu

Ok I loved this game ok but if you go to the sound test you put a code in not saying the code but then then... I found someone something it's it's a sonic with a creepy mask I feel like I'm being watched stay safe do not do this goodbye

Okay, this game has a good and unique soundtrack,( I prefer the Japanese soundtrack but that‚Äôs just me) the level design is great, and the Idea that you can go to the past and changed the future into a good one gives me chills. I‚Äôve been reading reviews that say a variety of things, from it not working on their Apple TV, to people saying SEGA is cheep because their free to play game has ads. I have been having no issues with ads whatsoever. Yeah, I got an ad after ever Zone, and sure I get an ad after I unpause, but is that really an excuse to trash on Sonic CD? People have been noting that the Metal Sonic battle in Stardust Speedway is difficult. I had a few retries on it myself, but maybe things get easier if you create a good future. I did experience the minor issue of Wacky Workbench Zone 3 is in Bad Future, but I didn‚Äôt really change much of the boss. If you think the boss music is creepy, try the Japanese game over music. I also read that Collision Chaos is difficult because of the pinball like aspect. Yeah, did you realize it‚Äôs called COLLISION CHAOS?!? I‚Äôm not sure if this was supposed to happen, but I‚Äôd you have the U.S soundtrack on, the music for past, or both futures don‚Äôt change from the Japanese soundtrack. This game paved the way for other great sonic the hedgehog games. Also, don‚Äôt compare the Metal Sonic fight in this game to the one in Sonic Generations, it was supposed to be easier. Small side note to all those who play Sonic Mania, there was an update that made Metal Sonic even more tough of a fight. The original fight was like this one, but then the update made the crew face Giga Metal Sonic... which might be a reference to the Final Boss in Sonic Heroes.... anyway, I managed to beat the game and create all Good Futures in all the Rounds and Zones in a Day and a Half. This game isn‚Äôt hard besides the Boss of Collision Chaos,( it took me a bit to realize what I had to do) also, most bosses go down in 2 hits.........
We NNNNNNNNNNEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEDDDDDDDDDD That ability!

Ok. This game.
THIS GAME.
It‚Äôs awesome. The characters are executed well and thus the game is too. Some of the bosses are super cheeseable, while others are super hard. I LOVE IT. The time travel overshadows sonic 06‚Äôs (for the best) and I love how you can change the future by changing the past. That‚Äôs really good! My only concern is the amount of ads. From the moment I turn on the game, I get a number of ads. Otherwise, it handles like a race car, and it‚Äôs great TEAM SEGA YEAH!
